The precious realm of Yang’s splendor,
transmuting the body, crystalline as snow, hidden frost.
Empty whiteness shimmering,
beyond the pavilion, the spirit still—relying on self-reflection.
Breaking through the murky crossroads,
revealing the perfect and all-penetrating five-hued pearl.
The Three Passes sealed,
bathed in jade nectar—countenance can be fulfilled.
The divine cinnabar nurtured,
eyes gleaming, exquisitely formed—enhancing the precious radiance.
The mysterious essence, profound and secluded,
the golden palace, the solitary Yang—clear and auspicious.
Two azure lads,
bearing the mysterious pearl into the Crimson Palace.
The spirit still, seated alone,
advancing sharply amidst the tumult—often self-humbled.
The outer gate forever barred,
the inner treasury sealed—guarding the precious vessel.
The mysterious light soars past,
piercing the void, the heart’s crucible shattered.
Golden and azure, cinnabar and jade,
the eyes filled with numinous mushrooms, the *qi*-image pure.
No words, no speech,
trusting in conditions, dissolving past karma.
Self and things both forgotten,
concealing traces, veiling light—virtue naturally grows.
The root of illusion extinguished,
awareness and illumination perfectly merged—forgetting the moon’s reflection.
Directly following the light,
a single heart-pearl merges with the sun’s radiance.

The esoteric formulas of true immortals
demand unwavering faith and loyalty to transmit.
When facing righteousness, be vigilant—
never trust the deceptive words that weigh short and long.

The jade mechanism leaks its secret,
the Dharma-eye’s numinous light pure and bright.
Penetrating the subtle and profound,
the sacred cassia blooms in the wintry forest as white feathers take flight.

Turn the head to reflect and awaken,
seeing through floating life as but a dream.
Abandon things to seek the real,
forgetting thoughts and form to exit the six dusts.

Heaven clear, earth still,
above and below, the void shines with the sun’s brilliance.
The radiant original spirit
roams the Yellow Capital and Purple Court in spring’s embrace.

Forgetting form, relinquishing illumination,
spotless and empty—truly the ultimate subtlety.
Beyond things, rosy clouds glow,
the celestial shore’s waves settle, merging with the Great Subtlety.

The cinnabar apertures unfold,
awakening to the profound mystery’s essential truth.
Emerging as stellar transformations,
the wind rides the numinous gale, the Changes’ images at play.

Silently guard within,
the inner yang pours forth from the midst of nothingness.
What is within this nothingness?
The solitary body, perfectly merged, illumines the sea-pearl.

Spirit clear, *qi* refined,
roaming the cinnabar heavens, bright as day.
Unrestrained above and below,
numinous blossoms densely fill the Great Void.

The scene-wind first appears,
auspicious clouds ride the nine transformations.
Only then is clarity trusted,
roaming the Southern Mound, pouring forth the white orb.

The numinous spirit barely glimpsed,
and already the new spring threads through a single line.
Wandering immortals beyond images
behold the Jade Pool’s five-colored lotuses.

The blind excel in hearing—
a single *qi* of clarity awakens wisdom’s nature.
The deaf can awaken—
two points of spirit enter the precious vessel.

Return from deception to truth,
like a jade mirror hung high in empty space.
Only when reflection is distinct
does one trust the golden elixir forms in a day.

Turn the head to question oneself,
returning the light to Penglai, utterly transparent.
A single mysterious pearl
circulates above and below, emerging from the six voids.

Perfectly merged with Heaven’s essence,
the image adapts, round and penetrating, essence flowing ceaselessly.
Unrestrained within and without,
roaming the midst of heaven without contraction or expansion.

The feathered one’s clarity and refinement
can turn midnight into spring’s daylight.
Roaming and guiding the central heavens,
exquisitely pure and wondrous—profound, yet again profound.

Subtle and dense, the essence-jewel,
scattered scenes of jade flowers stretch across the azure sky.
Sunlight on langgan jade,
the wind stilled, yet the chill of jade pendants lingers.

Meeting thus,
you say my soul flies and my heart trembles.
Seek not, search not—
when we meet, no good intention remains.

Tell them not to bow,
lest the poor remember old debts.
Each turn your head—
even slight deviation makes one a beast of burden.

**Seven Poems on Longing for Immortals**

Mountains link to waters, waters to mountains.
Waters graceful, mountains bright amid the scenery.
Clouds and rosy clouds—one taste of leisure.

Dawn wind wanes,
night deepens.
Moon ascends the plum’s tip, its shadow covering the altar.
The immortal’s sound, the chill of jade pendants.

The plain sky clears,
petals scatter like jade.
Faint numinous mist spreads across the earth.
Cold light, crisp *qi*, pure.

Precious essence congeals,
jade dawn stills.
The two luminaries’ radiance dazzles the sun’s brightness.
Langgan dots the Star of Longevity.

The Dao-heart tranquil,
the wisdom-lamp bright.
The jade-playing lad opens the Dao-scriptures.
Clear as the sound of jade pendants.

Serene and still,
radiant and congealed.
The swallow rests by the flowery pool, swallowing jade essence.
Returning to purity, the body naturally chaste.

Within, peace;
without, uprightness.
Within and without, no dwelling—all surveyed in clarity.
Every thing, every head, awakened.

*Qi* pure,
wisdom numinous.
Cold light reflects into the precious vessel.
Effortlessly transforming into jade essence.

Extinguish worldly passions,
awaken true sincerity.
Retreat to forests and springs, wandering clouds and waters.
Mist-light fills the eyes.

Radiant and still,
penetratingly clear.
Form released, heart congealed—the Dao naturally manifests.
Ascend the mysterious, illuminating the Jade Capital.

Diligently cultivate,
awaken to non-action.
Only wish the heart wise, the world unconfused.
Know clearly the mechanism of heaven and earth.

Precious rosy clouds glow,
brilliant and subtle.
The Purple Court and Green Capital await their time.
The Jade Palace reveals its sacred form.

The wisdom-blade appears,
slaying the Three Corpses.
Abide in integrity, purity, and detachment from love.
Serenely guard the plain essence.

Eyes bright,
the Dao full.
The azure sea’s cinnabar blossoms reveal the Jade Clarity.
Still, a single star.

**Six *Daolianzi* Poems**

Illumine the ancestral origin,
awaken to the true Chan.
A single point of numinous light emerges from before heaven.

The Changes’ green, cinnabar red,
yellow and plain mystery.
Still and auspicious, filling the mountains and rivers.

Frosty sky, wind stilled—naturally congealed.
Scattered jade flowers,
precious cassia round.

Speak not of the Dao,
seek not Chan.
Non-action and purity—excellent causes and conditions.

Awaken to the mysterious—
mysterious, yet again mysterious.
Cultivate true awakening,
seize the immortals’ authority.

Piercing gaze, radiant play in the cinnabar heavens.
The Five Numinous Ones take flight,
the Changes’ feathered immortals.

The practice of cultivation—
diligently inquire.
The unborn, undying Dao bears its task.

The Changes’ clear sky—
know the original heart.
Illumine movement and stillness,
stabilize the floating and sinking.

The jade infant ever guards the golden vessel.
Rosy clouds glow,
scattering precious peaks.

Truth conceals falsehood,
falsehood conceals truth.
Released, the solitary body severs distant and near.

Within the primordial chaos,
no self, no others.
Spirit communicates with the Dao,
the Dao with spirit.

Still as empty jade, like the ice-wheel.
Rolling the celestial river,
emerging from the six dusts.

From this head it arises,
to that head it proceeds.
Through the face’s gate, it enters and exits freely.

Heaven’s light appears—
a single star.

The true aspect,
the originally formless body—naturally bright.
Appearing in the vast yang,
entering great accomplishment.

Beneath the brows, the eyes—
the eyes’ essence.
The essence-light shines, brilliantly awakened.

Appearing in perfect merging,
illuminating beyond things.

Ascend to the Supreme Emperor,
circling the celestial court.
By the Moonflower Peak, play with cloudy blossoms.

Meeting the golden lad,
the Jade Clarity appears.

**Eleven *Xijiangyue* Poems**

Between the brows, intertwined amber,
the eyes’ pupils refined like dragon’s saliva.
Within the tripod, smoke curls to the Chan heavens.
A single point of numinous light emerges.

The Supreme Clarity illuminates this jade image,
the Tathāgata verifies this golden immortal.
The clear stream’s divergent branches share a single source.
Only by awakening to the principle does one know the highest good.

Vast *qi* congeals into a precious seal,
the clear wind scatters the clouded obscurity.
A wheel of bright moon illuminates the void.
Best to dance the spirit’s play.

Piercing through the Jade Capital above,
breaking open the Golden Gate within.
The original spirit sits alone in the Palace of Broad Cold.
Leading the host of immortals in ancestral veneration.

Regarding this body of mine, fraught with afflictions,
gazing upon the real—non-action, non-doing.

The Dipper’s handle turns the jade pivot of nature,
sun and moon cycle through heaven and earth in fullness.
Marking the ice-ash and snow-char,
firing them into flame-jujubes and intertwined pears.
All at once bestowed upon the lofty and graceful,
enhancing my wisdom and intelligence.
Yet all is blocked by household affairs and eaves,
obstructed by karmic hindrances.
Who can distinguish *li* from *wei*, right from wrong?
Turning away from the sacred offerings and Daoist discourse.
Clouds part, and every household sees the moon;
timely rains bring blossoms everywhere.
The pupil-child deeply enters emerald mist and rosy clouds,
guided to the everlasting spring of unending night.
No attachment to wind, flowers, snow, or moon,
casting aside wealth, honor, and fame.
Hollowing the heart, abandoning ambition, dismissing cleverness,
washing clean the illness of ignorance.
Shattering all illusions of the human realm,
only then does one penetrate the perfect completion beyond things.
Forgetting form, forsaking reflection, *qi* and spirit congeal.
Devoted to the root, delighting in heaven, knowing fate.
A staff bears a gourd of spring’s brew,
a case holds three feet of lustrous jade-sword.
The precious mirror between the brows subdues demons and evil,
sitting guard through the deep of midnight.
The golden tripod burns white snow,
the jade furnace refines the yellow sprout.
Elixir-light shimmers, rippling with jade brilliance,
heaven and earth intermingle in misty radiance.

Delusion sinks the body in seas of suffering,
awakening brings the moon forth on the western river.
A gentle breeze stirs the fragrance of osmanthus,
startling awake from a dream of roaming immortals.

Where do crane and phoenix lead?
A servant boy laughs, pointing toward the boundless dawn.
A jade tablet with golden characters bears the name "Southern Flourish"—
another realm between heaven and earth.

No need to gaze at stars or worship the moon,
why chant precepts or pore over scriptures?
Today I entrust you with this earnest charge:
life and death must rely on nature and destiny.

The Dao reveals all-knowing, supreme,
spiritual powers and the dharma-realm made perfectly clear.
No labor is needed—merit completes itself.
The will rests in non-action and purity.

Do not cling to gold, silver, or treasures,
nor covet jade-like beauty or flower-like faces.
A hundred years end in empty nothingness—
turning away from the Dharma of the Unborn.

To grasp the profound truth of the Mysterious,
one must understand the ancestral ways of the Most High.
The utterly divine, utterly sagely—awakening knows no bounds.
This freedom and ease arise of themselves.

Sever the copper ropes and iron nets,
strike open the jade locks and golden shackles.
Upon the stormy seas of suffering, board the spirit raft—
roam and play beneath the shade of the Tree of No Shadow.

No need to forget the signpost pointing at the moon,
why pluck osmanthus or pluck flowers?
Within the cauldron of the Great Void, refine cinnabar,
condensing the priceless Mystic Pearl.

Hold fast to the fundamental principle of nurturing life,
delusion leads to the mechanism of death.
Abandon the perverse, uphold the upright—what doubt remains?

There exists a wondrous and mysterious delight—
the infant frolics in the Jasper Park,
the azure youth laughs and points toward the Jade Pool.
Within the Moon of the Western River, cinnabar branches are plucked,
preserving and enhancing the spirit for enduring vision.

*Fisherman’s Pride, Five Poems*

Sunlight refines the yang soul in empty space,
the turning jade pivot revolves the celestial net.
Though near at hand, none perceive the man before their eyes.
A single thread connects—
the furnace opens, the cauldron splits, and celestial light appears.

Auspicious jade blossoms scatter in flakes,
fragrant winds softly brush the divine countenance.
In cold purity and serene emptiness, the feast is refined.
Truly enviable—
the Jade Emperor ascends the Liao Yang Palace.

Earthly po and heavenly hun diligently refined,
the essence of sun and marrow of moon yearn for each other.
The two luminaries exchange radiance like flashing lightning.
Clearly seen—
within the jade furnace, ten thousand golden flowers bloom.

Gently gathered and hammered into flakes,
round and round, shaped into a luminous form.
Dazzling the Great Void, jade hail is refined.
The divine light dazzles—
flying cinnabar pierces into the Hall of Pervading Clarity.

A century’s span races like a galloping steed,
floating splendor dazzles the eye through fleeting dust.
Mysterious vision cleansed, the spirit’s power set in motion.
The message is clear—
on the path of the Unborn, the truth is known.

Mists disperse, jade pupils ascend in celestial play,
yang light gradually reveals as pure yin withdraws.
Ten thousand specks of numinous cinnabar gleam on the void’s wall.
Bright and resplendent—
the elixir’s luster matches gold and jade in hue.

Chaos and obscurity traverse the cosmos,
colored clouds disperse, revealing the luminous jade hare.
The sun sets in the Salty Pool, then turns back to gaze.
The heart awakens—
congealing the hun and obscuring the po, the Golden Crow delights.

Fair and graceful, bearing the cold radiance of the ritual vase,
the triple-hued mist swirls in pure simplicity.
Directly encountering the Jasper Heaven, she carries the Woman Comet.
Unstained—
the cinnabar script forever binds her to the Jade Palace.

The Great Dao, most true, requires no words,
its radiance concealed, hidden in profound secrecy.
Preserve and refine the original essence without loss.
Dissolve the yin substance—
auspicious clouds bear forth the numinous yang sun.

Illuminating and shattering the gloom, it commands Heaven’s awe,
in utter vagueness and indistinctness, emptiness holds reality.
Luminous and immaculate, pure and white, they assist each other.
Attaining true unity—
the cinnabar script on jade tablets completes the immortal’s work.

*Immortal Homeland, Four Poems*

Easily attaining the pavilion of spontaneity,
beyond its eaves, pure splendor blends with freshness.
Cloud-linked peaks soar at the corners of the eaves,
numinous springs—
willow banks and misty waves connect to distant rivers.

Virtuous scholars conceal themselves in mystery,
mysterious vision cleansed, things naturally relinquished.
Within the empty altar, true delight is found,
dragon’s saliva—
sacred talismans lightly float, plucking the plain strings.

The Great Dao is fundamentally non-action,
within and without, serene in the wondrous mechanism.
In stillness and emptiness, true flavor is savored,
eyebrows raised—
the cold and pure divine light shines everywhere.

Graceful and elegant in bearing,
whether sitting, lying, walking, or dwelling, she follows at hand.
Winged, she ascends the central heavens, becoming a jade figure,
without doubt—
her place is in the Southern Palace, manifesting the Purple Tenuity.

The ancestral Dao is secretly transmitted,
having caught the rabbit, discard the snare and abide in spontaneity.
The eye’s horizon expands, revealing the Great Simplicity,
pure yang—
the sun’s radiant essence makes all things fresh.

Vague and indistinct, pervading the three thousand worlds,
foreknowing the shifting tides of hills and streams.
At the ocean’s depths, waves surge as the dragon emerges,
thrusting through the mysterious—
divine light bursts forth into the nine heavens.

The ancestral Dao is intermittently transmitted,
only then is the lineage’s wind confirmed to harmonize with nature.

The movement and stillness, being and non-being—guest and host in harmony,
the earth and heaven.
Above and below, the circling sun and moon shine fresh.
Radiance fills the three thousand worlds,
piercing valleys with numinous splendor, ever unchanging.
Within the void, a true jade figure takes form, ascending to heaven.
The Treasure Ease Child holds the elder’s white mystery.
The jade cage gleams,
guarding purity—
with steadfast resolve, utterly sever all dissipation.

Hold the inner realm,
moonlight piercing twin forests.
The jade child plays,
pointing afar to the heart of the azure pool—
scoop up the gold from the water.
The numinous treasure glows,
the lamp of wisdom shines,
divine light bears its task.
Face-to-face, yet none seek to grasp it.
If you awaken,
seeing clearly,
disaster and misfortune will not approach.
Dragons and tigers submit, ghosts and spirits revere.

**Two Poems to "The Courtyard Fragrance"**

The Dipper’s handle turns,
the Purple Tenuity first appears,
distant plains merge in pure clarity.
Cloud jade is ground away,
heaven’s treasure gleams with infant radiance.
Jade osmanthus and jasper forests, pristine feathers,
ascending the mysterious, they ride the dazzling flow of essence.
Cold and wondrous,
cinnabar and gold,
the mighty beacon transforms into a faint star.

Star emblems,
elegant and serene feasts—
pure wind conceals its rhythm,
forgetting form, forgetting appearance.
May our lineage awaken to understanding,
the heart released from floating glory.
Do not dwell on the distance of clouded mountains,
lift your gaze—
let not the numinous brightness dim.
In such truth,
the Azure Child flies away,
piercing the great Orchid City.

Again—
washing the belly, fasting the heart,
through frost and snow,
seeking the divine treasure’s essence-jewel.
Rely on your single act,
the pupil beholds the azure void.
The four bright heavens, free of floating veils,
ice cracks open—
all suspended images grow clear.
In the Starry Dawn Lodge,
jade tablets and golden characters—
who shall bind their fragrant name?

On the path,
people remain deluded,
their hearts straying onto crooked trails,
erring their way forward.
Returning to listen, long lost to the past,
movement and stillness arise anew.
The road to the divine Brahma palace is steady,
feasting in jasper forests,
light scatters like misty clouds.
The divine work is wondrous,
pure yang refined—
at dawn, the Purple Tenuity star appears.

**Three Poems to "Slow Voices"**

Beside misty waters, I dwell,
my humble abode on Song Peak,
the ends of heaven distant, communication cut off.
Yet enlightenment is not far—
before my eyes, the undivided pure wind.
The solitary precious moon, lofty and penetrating,
imprints a thousand pools,
illuminating the mysterious cavern.
No self, no other—
the primordial immortal scene of blended splendor,
one true emptiness.

With such understanding, heart-bound friends,
why offer tribute horses
or tread the dust of post roads?
I, weary in form,
need not travel far to meet you.
Bowing deeply,
flowing together—do not blame,
extend boundless compassion,
let not the heart be troubled.
Open the azure eye,
cast the divine light into the body,
entering the unmoving ancestral Dao.

Again—
the original unity of nature—
where was it arranged?
It came from the vague and indistinct void.
Receiving qi, forming shape,
father’s essence and mother’s blood congeal into an embryo.
Gradually, the fetus completes and descends,
before it can grow,
emotions turn wayward.
Self-inflicted ruin—
on the road, toiling endlessly,
slowly entangled in dust.

Vainly, a lifetime spent in inversion,
obscuring heaven’s natural treasure,
buried for ten thousand ages.
If you awaken to life’s prior truth,
the mysterious crucible splits the heart open.
Merging with the sun, congealing pure yang’s elegance,
gathering the five directions,
rosy clouds swirl back.
The jade morning manifests—
then forget form, abandon reflection,
ride straight to the Jasper Terrace.

Again—
hewing open chaos,
striking through Kunlun,
the Dipper’s handle turns the wheel of heaven.
On the winding shore, the crow and toad,
exchanging soaring, fleeing souls.
The mercury tripod and lead furnace blaze,
refining golden essence,
wood’s liquid and cinnabar’s dawn.
Starlight manifests,
dispersing the primordial one qi,
ten thousand lands veiled in rosy mist.

Luminous, still, without obstruction,
clashing mountains, rivers, forests, and gardens—
ten thousand gleams shimmer.
High and low, no difference—
distant plains merge in pure essence.
Face-to-face, who awakens to this?
In vain, laboring,
turning from enlightenment to chase illusions.
Cease anger—
like a blind man groping an elephant,
erring, losing heaven’s truth.

**Two Poems to "The River All Red"**

Spring flowers, autumn moon,
from ancient times to now, but a fleeting moment.
Wealth and nobility, wisdom and folly—
how many times have they turned?
Life and death, like ants, follow their cycles.
The immortal realm, though near,
its path beyond the dust—
as if separated by ten thousand mountains.
Awakening, return—
truly nurture simplicity in tranquility,
rejoice in pure leisure.

Worldly affairs, all unstained—
a body of purity,
a heart of non-action, observing with stillness.
Jade’s brilliance, gold’s radiance—look outward.
Bursting forth, ten thousand measures of bright pearls,
pushed through the two gates.
Within the Supreme Ultimate’s palace,
the inner elixir congeals.
Pure wind, fragrant and resplendent, pierces jade branches.
Ten thousand qi circulate, returning to one body—
a thousand true wondrous uses,
emotions without duality.
Merging into the Middle Primordial realm,
flutes and cranes drift ethereally,
auspicious qi coils and lingers.
The jade decree fills the empty azure,
names inscribed for immortal ascent—
riding chariots, driving phoenixes and simurghs.

Again—
raising the hairpin, staff in hand,
enjoying the moon, the wind’s message along the path.
Embracing the one, harmonious and balanced,
nurturing the knife-point’s mercury and lead.
Golden essence, wood’s liquid, moisten the radiant field.
Securely guarding the three spirits, returning to the fire palace,
five-colored clouds cover the earth,
light piercing the Brahma heavens.
Tiger and dragon intertwine—
the cosmos’s bright pearl is seized,
qi’s image trickles like a stream.
Treasure clouds glow with the sun,
brilliant yang’s radiance blazes,
reflecting back into the mysterious cavern.
Within the merged, dawn and dusk blend.
The dharma of ten thousand images, clear and round,
competing in freshness with all things.
Profound stillness, cold source—
ever before the eyes.
Within the void, rippling waves surge in the essence’s abyss.
Nine-hued yellow clouds shroud the night’s mist,
three peaks’ blue haze
reach far to ten thousand rivers.
The Dao complete, pure and refined—
yin’s mists scatter,
all things come to life.
The treasure’s image holds the spirit’s essence—
amid the six dusts’ heap,
lifting forth a blessed immortal.

**A Leaf Boat**

Ten thousand images surge open, vast and boundless,
the primordial qi blends in empty support.
The sea’s moon, tranquil and golden,
illuminates the heart of heaven.
Beyond the eyelashes, majestic spirit’s radiance unfolds,
an ice body, snow skin, graceful and delicate.
Steadily crossing jasper forests,
ascending the jade peak.

**Two Returning Songs**

The principle of cultivating truth—
where lies the mechanism of the Dipper’s meditation?
Vast thoughts of tangled vines, empty strife—
many efforts, all vain labor,
how could they compare to awakening to non-action?

Open the Dao’s eye,
the single nature emerges from confusion.
Dense bamboo does not hinder flowing water,
lofty mountains cannot block white clouds in flight.

Ascending the subtle purples of the Empyrean,
the Void-and-None Dao,
where primordial qi harmonizes of itself.

The dark mirror’s cleansing—few worthy scholars remain,
while those who cling to dust and turn from awakening are many,
frittering days in vain.

Open the Dharma-eye,
a single nature pierces through Saṃsāra.
Luminous, clear as autumn’s cold moon,
crystalline, like rippling waves of jade.
Pouring forth to moisten the numinous bough.

**Waves and Sands**

Seeking the Dao, consulting masters,
pledging vows, submitting petitions.
Be vigilant from beginning to end, diligent in cultivation.
Yield to others, advance the self, ever patient in humility,
all affairs governed by boundless compassion.

The mechanism of ascending immortals lies broken—
hold fast to rectitude, unwavering.
Uphold the practice of the Primordial Jade Purity.
When the sun of wisdom shines in the void, who shall illuminate it?
Stellar eyes, lingzhi brows.

**Two Songs of Picking Mulberries**

Strength and fate deride each other—
rely on truth to see who is right, who is wrong.
Once I sought the Western Gate at the Northern Palace;
know then the Eastern Wall’s words,
sincere and fair—why doubt the nurturing of simplicity?

The vulgar cannot comprehend.
Awaken the worthy and wise,
to walk my path in shared principle.
Rejoice in heaven’s decree, pass through life by following conditions.
When merit is complete in years to come,
the old path to the Divine Empyrean
holds our immortal tryst.

Our kind may well lament—
discarding the dark pearl,
adrift at the edge of heaven.
Floating clouds, flying catkins, rootless and anchorless,
the heart strays down divergent paths,
each rising thought leading steps astray.

Hear early the call of mist and rosy clouds—
within the immortal realm,
how fine to press onward!
The Three Mountains lie close, not far,
where the Jade Hall of Ever-Spring,
the twin shores of Lingxi,
brim with jasper blossoms.

**Two Songs of Wandering Hua-Xu**

On ancient banks, peach buds unfurl,
the new moon’s pure light intertwines in splendor.
How many in the dusty world glimpse this?
Only I fix my gaze with lofty intent.

A sigh—
a sigh—
turning back, the distant journey to immortal realms.

Roaring through the ancient wind, beneath the moonlit stream,
radiance gleams through the vast, limpid void.
Lovely eyes glance, clear and round,
vanishing, then waxing full again.

Light connects—
light connects—
jade osmanthus in frosty groves, crystalline and pure.

**Two Songs of Voicing Grievances**

Forest springs, a reclusive livelihood,
forsaking the clamor of prosperity.
The immortal of verdant Zhongshan peaks,
eyes brimming with numinous cinnabar.

Congealing the white elixir,
blending with cinnabar clouds,
bursting forth jasper blossoms.
Cloud waves, misty billows—
beyond the isles, Fanghu’s abode,
where dwell the people of that realm.

The Great Void, boundless and fathomless,
where no-qi blends at the center.
Glancing back, the revolving tripods,
jade liquid overflowing with golden sand.

Radiant spirit’s glow,
flashing beams of light,
shimmering jasper blossoms.
Clouds recede, waves subside,
the sea stills, the sky clears—
the vast expanse’s home.

**Night Travel by Boat**

Within the snow-washed pouch, no worldly things.
Carefree and indolent—who would constrain me?
No fear of hollow fame,
no glory, no disgrace.
How few follow in such lightness!

Alone I sit, plucking strings, the goblet brimming with fine wine.
With hairpin raised, I watch the drifting clouds unbroken.
Turtles glide on the pond,
cranes stride before the grotto,
wind and moon, water and mountain, pine and bamboo.

Alas for the splendid years spent plumbing profound truths—
midway stalled,
the teachings left masterless.

**The Daoist Abbey**

The abbey stands desolate,
old friends grown distant and faint—
how much worse the gloom of dusk’s sorrowful rain.

Alone I sit, a guest in silent emptiness,
my crimson heart laid bare—
who would fathom its depths?
Sweeping my sleeves, I return to the mountains,
to the depths of emerald streams,
to whisper to falling blossoms and flowing waters.

**Two Libations to the River Moon**

I. The wondrous Dao of serene emptiness,
merged with the dim and boundless,
pervades the subtle, the pure, the absolute.
Emerging before heaven, it illumines the Lord of Images,
filling the eye with streaming fragments of radiant mist.
The impure form dissolves,
jade scrolls flourish,
the sacred tripod’s elixir congeals.
The cinnabar bloom gathers its splendor,
pristine and profound, a single hue of clarity.

Essence □□□ fills the void,
clear as an autumn night,
the sea’s osmanthus untouched by wax or wane.
Shining through ancient and present, it pierces the luminous qi,
brimming like a jade flask of spring snow.
Resplendent as the sun’s pure essence,
the steadfast heart’s hidden purity,
it nourishes the true immortals’ delight.
The cinnabar script summons the decree—
ascending to the Three Luminaries in array.

II. The primordial Dao of the Mysterious Origin,
boundless, formless,
stands solitary in stillness and silence.
Pervading all directions, it links above and below,
its gaze stretching to the faintest glimmer of celestial light.
Concealing and revealing, vanishing and enduring,
piercing non-being to thread being,
its benevolent work leaves no trace.
Resonant and unconstrained, it releases transformation—
a single numinous essence in the vast expanse.

Ascending the forest, it penetrates true yang,
its perfect brightness illuminating all,
allowing not a speck of dust to hide.
The principle must inevitably unfold—yet still ungrasped,
I explain it plainly to my disciples.
The sun’s hall gleams with auspicious light,
the moon’s palace shimmers with propitious hues,
a thousand streams enriched by jade waves.
Spirit congeals, form dissolves—
the jasper cliffs stand as before, verdant and sheer.

**Three Southern Branch Songs**

I.
A blink—lost through kalpas,
a glance—separated by ten thousand peaks.
A single truth divides its auspice through twin gates,
merged with primordial chaos—
what difficulty remains?

The body crumbles, golden wings take flight,
yang’s doubt pierces the jade ring.
Suddenly awakened, I wash the dream-soul’s realm.
The lotus petals drift away, heartless,
beyond the world, alone in purity.

II.
The heart’s resolve is pure and steadfast,
the will’s truth unyielding and true.
Transcending the pitfalls of cessation and permanence,
the eye’s horizon widens,
radiant, illuminating the luminous clarity.

The brocade of heaven and earth gleams,
the intricate world shines.
The limpid void, like a flawless jade disc, instantly rounds into perfection.
Shedding the husk, the essence (目十爫十缶)—
a single star in the azure sky.

III.
Weary of stillness, I once dwelled in the marketplace;
disdaining clamor, I then lived in the mountains.

Where in the communion with the True is there no purity and leisure?
Within and without, I roam carefree,
unfettered by the climb for profit or renown.
The husk shed, I manifest in emptiness,
the form forgotten, I gaze beyond the world.

The two spirits congeal in pristine clarity, emerging through the Gate of Yang.
The crane’s nature, light and fleet,
departs for ancient Chang’an.

**Two Red-Window Poems**

Seek the Mystery Gate—cease your vain quests.
I point to you the true aim of cultivation:
ever pure and still, the mind unadrift,
preserve the primordial essence without loss.

Refine the yang soul, dissolve the yin substance.
Between the brows, the divine radiance takes flight.
Through the Dipper’s handle, turn the Celestial Pivot,
embrace the single wheel of the red sun.

Again—

Cast off worldly passions, return to true principle.
Strike the double gates, the Mystery Gate swings wide.
Spit forth the divine light, piercing the curtains and veils,
revealing the wondrous yang body.

The Golden Crow’s essence, the Jade Hare’s marrow—
illuminating heaven and earth, the pupils gleam with luminous clarity.
The distant red window blazes with radiant perfection,
shining through Penglai’s depths to the very end.

**Two "Pointing Crimson Lips" Poems**

Lush hues swirl in mist,

Light flashes and flickers—

Exiled to the mortal realm,

**Two "Wu Ling Spring" Poems**

The cool, serene divine light sways in emptiness,

A single parasol leaf falls beyond the window,

Staff in hand, cap askew, I wander at ease,
bewildered by the winding Pool of Qujiang.
The crane’s chariot hurries back along the old path—

listening to the tuneless melody—

**Ascending the Western Heights**

Awaken the mysterious essence, clarify the true qi,
penetrate the primordial within.
By day, the yang soul; by night, the yin spirit—they merge.

auspicious clouds floating, their light striking the Jade Palace.
Dispersing the yin vapors, congealing the pure and refined,
returning the spirit to transformation, moving through the numinous void.

brilliant and resplendent.
Roaming the central heavens,
the lush rosy clouds’ jade tones pure.
Rainbow banners and feathered standards,
bearing the jade chariot, the treasure-scented immortal winds.

**Two "Spring in Qin Garden" Poems**

In this world, as a person,
none surpasses parents in profound virtue and deep grace.
From the ten months in the womb, three years of nursing,
turning dry for wet, how much toil endured?
Grown to adulthood, the five eyes of the heart arise—
outsiders sow discord, each leading their own gate.
Who awakens?
Like the owl facing its nest,
the karmic retribution circles back.

Cease this vain toil of the spirit.
Never forget the grace of the womb and nursing.
Recall the crow’s filial return, the gibbon’s evasion of arrows—
with sincere filial reverence, what curse could befall one?
In all matters, do not defy,
follow their countenance, harmonize their needs.
In food and drink, cold and warmth, use them in due measure.
Preserve this from beginning to end—
the Dao’s light shines across the four seas,
virtue spreads in pure sincerity.

Again—

In youth’s bloom, I suddenly awakened and turned back,
indulging my nature, following my truth.
Abandoning father, mother, brothers, and sisters-in-law,
wife, sons, nephews, and daughters—
a solitary cloud, a wild crane, for over twenty springs.
Like a drifting duckweed, I followed the winds,
settling wherever fate allowed,
letting others laugh at my indolence.
Do not blame me—
weary of life’s falsity and pretense,
I awakened to my former existence.

Clearly knowing the primordial spirit beyond appearances.

Radiant treasures, immaculate without blemish, unstained by dust.
Mastering the four seasons’ chariot,
pointing to heaven as canopy,
earth’s authority as carriage,
sun and moon as discourse.
Rolling through the starry river,
breaking through the Ox and Dipper,
gathering and dispersing the five-colored clouds afloat in the void.
Traversing the Three Realms,
manifesting the August Sage Ancestor of the Void,
the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning.

*To the tune of* "Court Full of Fragrance"

With grain sacks and bamboo hats,

enduring distant roads, undaunted by wind and frost.

First, the supreme principle reveals the One Nature;
then the Two Modes appear,
and the Three Palaces shine resplendent.
Beyond the Mystic Pass,
hovering in the void, luminous—
the rising sun spreads its crimson light.

All spirits,

who can preserve
the primal yang within the Jade Treasury?
Myriad gods intermingle in splendor,
the ninefold qi blends at the center.
A single Mystic Pearl is formed,
its divine radiance
illuminating the Southern Prosperity.
In the Liao-Yang Lodge,
entering and exiting the Flowering Chamber,
all join in singing *Court Full of Fragrance*.

Nurture spirit, sustain life.
Guard the true source, return to authentic rightness.
Silent and limpid, vast and serene.
The profound root of emptiness is firm,
the heart attuned to the Dao communes with the sacred.
Naturally, all monstrosities withdraw,
only then do the myriad spirits rejoice as one.
Merging with numinous light into the Great Beginning,
in the void appears the luminous mirror of the mind.

**Pure, pure, pure.**

Sever thought, forget emotion.
Cultivate right awakening, swiftly attain perfection.
The sea stills into emptiness, vast and boundless as the celestial forest.
A jade flask chills with autumn waters, a golden well pours forth icy jade-green.
Clouds part to reveal the lofty heavens,
the spirit-terrace gleams bright and clear.
Above the three thousand realms, the mind clarifies and expands—
in the moonlit tower, one sits alone gazing toward Penglai.

**Still, still, still.**
Empty the heart, enter samādhi.
Establish true practice, cultivate true conduct.
Cool and refreshing, limpid and awakened,
the profound essence shimmers like deep autumn waves,
mirroring the distant autumn river.
The moon of the Three Heavens shines dustless,
the immortal winds of ten thousand leagues gleam jade-green.
With a single stroke, all things are severed—
solitary, one sits in cultivation of body and life.

**Steady, steady, steady.**
Return to the origin, restore the beginning.
From being arises, from non-being emerges.
The spirit roams the boundless void, piercing inner and outer.
Within and without, awareness merges with emptiness,
the three yang currents flow into the body.
Self and world dissolve into the origin,
the ten thousand transformations arise from no-other.
A single ripple of cold light rises from the azure pool,
illuminating Penglai’s isles to their radiant depths.

**First, first, first.**

**Through the spirit, gate and window.**
Gaze upon the Southern Apex, glance at the Northern Dipper.
Lord of a thousand transformations, master of ten thousand changes.
The handle of the celestial Dipper turns the mechanism,
the pivot of the Gate of Yi revolves the elbow.
Revealing the Jade Hare’s golden essence,
merging with the numinous void’s wisdom-mouth.
Vast, it overflows the eyes and fills all existence—
ascending the mysterious Dao, the Great Non-Being within Being.

**Precious, precious, precious.**
No old, no new.
Cast off noble and base, sever near and distant.
Naturally ascending and descending,
darkly drawing in ghosts and spirits.
Radiance surges like the blazing sun,
luminous purity gleams without dust.
The Great Dao observes as one body—
awakening, there is no self, no other.
In the Seven Treasures Grove, Infant and Maiden play,
the high void’s wind and moon become close neighbors.

**Profound, profound, profound.**
No limit, no end.
Sun and moon as one, heaven and earth together.
Pervading empty space, unshaken and unmoved.
Resplendent, flawless, without blemish,
brilliant, boundless, seamless.
Wielding my great power and divine penetration,
crushing the minute and subtle to draw near.
Let the Crow and Hare fly to and fro as they will—
the spirit’s light first awakens to the constant use.

**Cultivate, cultivate, cultivate.**

Fierce resolve, a turn of the head.
Opening the Dao-eye, unfolding the clear gaze.
The Flowery Pond brims full,
spirit-water overflows in its course.
Sunlight illumines the pure realm,
moon’s luster shines on clear autumn.
Seated, one beholds the celestial script of jade,
moving, one rides the earth’s golden ox.
The vast expanse traversed without trace,
stepping beyond the heavens, roaming beyond things.

**Walk, walk, walk.**
Vigilant, utmost sincerity.
Cultivating the superior adept,
abiding in non-contention.
Nurturing spirit, fostering qi,
preserving life, attaining long life.
Treading the void to commune with the Great Dao,
circling and stepping through empty clarity.
The ancient path stands level and true,
no straying into wilds or reckless flight.
Red dust of the worldly road never drifts near—
a single journey to wander the Jasper Capital.

**Blade, blade, blade.**
Three feet long, fine as a breath.
No filth or clamor,
cutting off dust and noise.
Shearing away ghosts and demons,
cleaving asunder worldly toil.
On mountain peaks seizing rhinos and tigers,
in the sea’s depths slaying dragons and serpents.
By night entrusted to the Southern Asterism and Northern Dipper,
by day enfeoffing the sea’s peaks and heaven’s waist.
Its form enters the void, unknown to others—
a single thread of pure qi ascends to the cinnabar heavens.

**Spear, spear, spear.**

**Spear, spear, spear.**
Attaining the great, boundless in form.
Radiant as the sun’s brilliance, illuminating heaven’s light.
Virtue subdues ghosts and demons,
battle repels demon kings.
Cleaving open the sea of perfect enlightenment,
piercing through the azure vault of heaven.
Upright, it thrusts through sky and props up earth;
held crosswise, it pacifies the frontier.
Disciples who master the golden spear technique
no longer cling to the stench of maggots and festering sores.

**Dragon, dragon, dragon.**
Emerging strange, surpassing the crowd.
In motion fierce, in stillness heroic.
Mouth spewing flames of fire,
ears sipping the cold wind.
Its two eyes conceal sun and moon,
its belly encompasses the cosmos.
Unfurls its claws to overturn the dharma-realm,
grinds its horns to scrape through Kunlun.
A single thunderous roar shakes the heavens—
the three rivers and four seas all hear its name.

**Tiger, tiger, tiger.**
Central, the primal mother.
King of all beasts, ancestor of the mountains.
Fierce and heroic,
lord of heaven and earth.
A single hair devours the four plums,
its two eyes dissolve past and present.
Pulls mountains to shake earth and sky,
paces the void to tread open the Purple Palace.
In furious roar, it deafens the celestial thoroughfare—
a single cry startles the Dark Warrior.

**Spirit, spirit.**

Formless, the dharmakāya.
Heart’s treasure, Dao’s rarity.
Vast it encompasses heaven and earth,
minute it enters the tiniest dust.
Pushes aside the handle of stars,
turns the pivot of sunlight’s wheel.
Darkly conceals the unerring mechanism,
clearly discerns the primordial mystery.
Shatters a thousand gates to open ten thousand dharmas—
the boundless sky blazes, transmuting into pure yang.

**Qi**
**Qi, qi.**
Unobstructed, unclosed.
Root of heaven and earth,
thread of the Void.
The Great Dao flows through,
spiritual mechanism interlocks.
Permeates the cosmos with primordial chaos,
chaotic harmony universally sustains.
Ceaselessly circulates breath in fusion—
silently nurtures the true form’s restraint.
Naturally the empty valley transforms the spirit,
jade blossoms scatter where they ascend to the Celestial Emperor.

**Luminosity**
**Luminous, luminous.**
Earth still, heaven clear.
The Great Void expansive,
vast and boundless.
Within the realm, emptiness and stillness—
island seas, clouds serene.
Scorching sun blazes resplendent,
divine radiance gleams concentrated.
Illumines and reflects all things at dawn,
silver abyss fills the eye, level and smooth.
The numinous void lets my spirit play freely—
jade lads leap into the crystal city.

**Essence**
**Essence, essence.**

**Penetrating Sun, Sinking Seas.**
Vapors rise in lush profusion,
auspicious qi takes form.
Wind stills, waves settle—
ripples drift like shooting stars.
Intertwined radiance simmers jade snow,
luminous moonbeams gleam bright.
Heaven and earth stand as a golden crucible,
brimming full with liquid silver’s sheen.
Dawn’s sky strikes jade-green clouds of emerald haze,
brilliant and boundless, the Great Purity appears.

**True**
**True, true.**
Limpid and pure,
light renewed.
Subtle beyond measure,
vast beyond end.
Pervading the primordial beginning,
the Brahmā heavens stretch boundless.
Wind clears, wafting through Kan’s gate;
moon shines, piercing Li’s palace.
In desire, the spirit’s abyss is desireless;
amid dust, the great Dao is dustless.
The Dao—though not the Dao—knows the constant Dao;
spiritual transformation—though no-spirit—is thus spirit.

**Empty**
**Empty, empty.**
The Great Ultimate,
interconnected.
Embracing the great image,
all-encompassing.
Five Phases cannot reach it,
Eight Trigrams cannot fathom.
Vast and void, above and below,
unbound, east and west.
No trace, no form, no shadow—
neither blue nor green nor red.
From ancient past to present, hard to discern,
yet by force of name, the great Dao establishes heaven and earth.

**See**
**See, see.**

**Originally,**
**the head and face.**
Opening the eye of wisdom,
divine radiance shines forth.
Mirroring brilliance without form,
the great void manifests.
Twin streaks of lightning fly,
dazzling as silver silk.
Following the moment, self and things dwell as one;
in application, knowing the constant amid ten thousand changes.
A single wheel of wisdom’s eye illumines the celestial steps—
the Jade Infant leaps into the Hall of Luminous Pervasion.

**Hear**
**Hear, hear.**
Examining intent,
profound and still.
Returning to original nature,
awakening the true heart.
Washing away Zheng and Wei,
sound and color cannot invade.
Right and wrong—how could they enter the ear?
Ever hearing the tiger’s roar and dragon’s chant.
Unplayed, the celestial music arises naturally;
the primeval tone resounds, deep and ancient.
The valley of wisdom rings with pure resonance—
a single note pierces the ninefold forest of clouds.

**Know**
**Know, know.**
Within and without,
heaven’s mystery.
Communing with true subtlety,
attaining the profound and minute.
No cultivation, no attainment,
no action, no striving.
Luminous as kingfisher jade,
the Dragon Child gleams in crimson robes.
Inner and outer shine through, clear and bright;
the heart opens—all dharmas are not.
The vast sea reveals the heart-moon’s single wheel,
its essence flashing forth in radiant splendor.

**Awake**
**Awake, awake.**

On all sides, a single circuit.
With spiritual penetration, yet nameless simplicity.
The body entire—empty space;
dharma and not-dharma alike.
The adept fundamentally non-acting,
yet the unenlightened—both eyes blind.
The mystery plainly revealed,
yet face-to-face, the spirit’s thought drifts distant.
A single celestial path, immaculate and dustless—
golden crow scattering, silver light cascading.

**Exhaust**
**Exhaust, exhaust.**
Earth quakes, heaven turns.
Piercing the valley’s spirit, penetrating the mysterious female.
The more one practices, the farther it seems;
the more one employs, the nearer it grows.
Gazing afar, it spans heaven’s thoroughfare;
drawn close, it pervades a single inch.
Seeking, the earth’s corners yield no trace;
vast, the sahā world remains unmoved.
The luminous inscription—pure emptiness, the body of great void;
the sunlit abyss—who lacks its boundless share?

**Virtue**
**Virtue, virtue.**
Fathomless, evanescent.
Externally, an empty heart;
internally, a full belly.
The moon encircles the Li Palace,
a pure breeze enters the kingdom.
A single pearl blazes in the sky,
illuminating the darkness of ignorance.
Radiant, it merges with the dust in harmony;
pervading the world, utterly void of obstruction.
As one yin dissolves, one yang arises—
the flawless jade of emptiness suffuses all.

**Attain**
**Attain, attain.**

**No Cause, No Effect.**
Sever greed and wrath, dissolve self and other.
Still the mind—smoke dissipates;
clear the heart—fire is extinguished.
Shatter the patriarch’s barrier,
unlock the dragon-phoenix shackles.
Jewels of flawless jade abound,
yet within lies a single Mystic Pearl.
The Mystic Pearl divides as the Jade Infant pays homage,
a golden lotus bud held firm in the embrace.

**Attain**
**Attain, attain.**
Illumine Kan, brighten Li.
Spirit meets in harmony, the Dao walks hand in hand.
Grasp the void—no delusion remains in the heart.
Heaven’s clarity transmits the wondrous dharma,
earth’s stillness reveals the subtle and profound.
Heaven and earth share one heart,
luminous yet vast beyond kalpas, beyond sound.
From ancient times, unbroken, boundless—nothing to grasp,
the spirit roams the azure vaults, level with the Great Abyss.

**Act**
**Act, act.**
Awaken to truth, free from delusion.
Unseal the nature’s awareness, realize the heart’s wisdom.
Wash away all contrivance,
no thought of Chan’s mechanism.
Strike through each and every one,
every thing withdraws its radiance.
The body merges with heaven’s emptiness, the sea’s stillness;
awakening reveals the ten thousand dharmas as nonexistent.
Within the Mystery, a fragrant breeze stirs,
the spirit transforms—moonlight spills full in the west.

**Eternal**
**Eternal, eternal.**

Still the sitting, dissolve the details.
Suddenly the still realm—awareness turns cool and clear.
The Radiant Youth opens the way,
guides into the immortal land.
Seal-script smoke veils earth’s beauty,
bright candles illuminate heaven’s light.
Bestowed with peach of immortality and cassia wine,
drunk and drowsing in lofty halls.
Suddenly a pure melody arises,
jade maidens vie to support me into the grotto chamber.

**Yang**
**Yang, yang.**
Pervading, filling all directions.
Virtue manifests transformation, the Dao expands.
Golden essence flows and scatters,
treasured seals emit radiance.
Light soars through the Milky Way’s bones,
crimson dyes the vast azure.
Reflecting back, not beyond daily use,
returning to the origin, first awakening to true constancy.
Stripping away pure yin, the ancient Dao is revealed,
the spirit elixir unimpeded—heaven’s eternity attained.

**Leisure**
**Leisure, leisure.**
Utmost sageliness, beyond the ordinary.
Morning in the still realm, departing the dusty world.
Truth intermingles with truth, each thing without attachment.
Water and clouds ever companions,
wind and moon the homeland.
Thirst quenched with cassia wine from the gourd,
drunk, alone reclining on Kun Mountain.
A single dream of roaming immortals—
freely, carefree between heaven and earth.

**Vermilion**
**Vermilion, vermilion.**

**Youthful Spring**
**Youthful spring, youthful spring—**
at sixteen, naturally paired,
breath shared in perfect accord.
Jade countenance, fair flesh,
elegant and refined.
Matched beneath embroidered curtains,
dreaming as one, startling awake.
Suddenly leaping from the silken chamber,
golden blossoms scattered in disarray.
Eyes fixed, never to part,
hearts in bright union circling the Morning Palace.

**Breath**
**Breath, breath—**
breath. Solitary, self-standing.
No outward invasion,
no inward intrusion.
Born of the true heart,
formless in essence.
Silent, the hall of utmost emptiness;
desolate, the chamber of stillness.
Two painted candles illumine the void,
their light mirroring a blazing sun.
What doubt remains in this truth?
In pure quiescence, all affairs are complete.

**Mystery**
**Mystery, mystery—**
mystery. Radiant, yet not dazzling.
Gazing at heaven,
soaring through the boundless sky.
The Supreme Polarity’s subtle profundity,
vast, without limit.
Moon on water mirrors the azure void,
reflecting back in luminous return.
Myriad methods awaken to the One Method,
the One Method held in three essentials.
Preserving the Three, guarding the One—qi and spirit clarified,
transmuting yang essence to descend through the nine apertures.

**Law**
**Law, law.**

No question,
no answer.
Penetrating the mysterious vision,
dwelling in absolute learning.
Beyond names and words,
knowing emptiness in sudden awakening.
Sudden awakening—Dao is without mind,
through mind, the same as the chick’s first peck.
Fused, sun and moon shine as one,
pervading mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks.
Heaven’s nature in humanity,
humanity’s nature in heaven—
naturally, a single nameless simplicity.

**Dao**
**Dao, Dao—**
Dao. Subtle,
profound.
True reality,
without form or appearance.
Mystery within mystery,
wonder within wonder.
Myriad things flourish of themselves,
their arising not by contrivance.
Revolving, sun and moon soar through the void;
scattered, they illumine the ten directions.
Awakened, there is no earth, no heaven—
the sage merely posits an empty name.

**Virtue**
**Virtue, virtue—**
Virtue. Nourishing,
all things.
Pervading east and west,
penetrating south and north.
Resplendent yet formless,
the great void silent.
Splitting open the marrow of dragon and phoenix,
shattering the sinews and bones of heaven.
Golden essence scatters in streaming radiance,
piercing through the cosmos in vagueness.
Spirit-light, dazzling, coalesces into a crimson mass—
gathered, it enters the cavern of the golden crow.

**Water**
**Water, water.**

**Trickling, trickling,**
unceasing.
Above, no waves;
below, no bottom.
Welling and surging in the void,
dragon’s fat and phoenix’s marrow.
A single taste irrigates the heart-field,
moistening and nurturing the body of cultivated truth.
Skin pure as frost and snow,
pure yang naturally void of yin ghosts.
Bright eyes lift the brows beyond the great void—
without moving a step, one rises in empty space.

**Pool**
**Pool, pool, pool.**
Willow banks,
dikes that droop.
Dividing water-valleys,
illumining cold streams.
Golden waves lightly ripple,
jade liquid pours in abundance.
The silver toad casts snowy billows,
dazzling the eye with boundless depths.
A single moistening sets valley streams flowing in relief;
harmony surges, myriad transformations rest in ease.
The flowery pool’s divine water exists in every household—
the adept acts without acting, without striving.

**Fluid**
**Fluid, fluid.**
Spontaneous,
ebbing and flowing.
Nurturing clear flesh,
cultivating numinous substance.
Externally aligning with the celestial circuit,
internally merging with the chamber of spirit.
The Palace of Fire brims and overflows,
the eye beholds pristine light dripping.
Mysterious frost congeals into a rich balm,
essence blazes red as the scorching sun.
A single speck of the fetal star transcends the immortal palace—
the face reveals the Three Clarities’ work complete.

**Elixir**
**Elixir, elixir.**

**Heaven and Earth,**
**between them.**
Soaring phoenixes distant, fire dragons wheeling.
Pivotal mechanisms gather the essential,
revolving the Golden Gate.
Gathering the essence of the Three Luminaries,
reversing the cycle through the Seven Apertures.
A single pellet enfolds the cosmos,
transforming to inhale plum blossoms and swallow mountains.
Feeding on enlightenment, ascending to court the Purple Palace—
inscribed in the Jade Register, ranked among the immortals’ host.

**Nature**
**Nature, nature.**
Numinous source,
communing with the sage.
No awareness, no seeing or hearing.
Clear as a cold spring,
luminous as a precious mirror.
Reflecting yet formless,
things arrive and respond in kind.
Knowing the heart departs from desire to contemplate emptiness,
facing circumstances, right and wrong distinguish themselves.
Lodging at night in the Toad Palace to pluck osmanthus,
at dawn leaping into the Golden Crow’s path.

**Life**
**Life, life.**
Let it not
contend or compete.
Move with the seasons, respond to their flow.
Pure, still, and serene,
perfect in bearing, qi abundant.
Essence securely preserved, spirit whole—
only then does the true heart settle.
Blood within the body transmutes to balm,
flesh and bone equally fuse, lustrous and clear.
The elixir perfected, pure yang emerges from the Five Phases—
a decree descends from the Jade Void, proclaiming the mandate.

**Lead**
**Lead, lead.**

Boundless, without edge.
Essence dense and lush, qi unbroken and flowing.
Movement gives birth to the ten thousand things,
stillness of the sea, profound and dark.
The profound and dark—marrow of heaven and earth,
movement and stillness—root and origin of the Dao.
Seen, yet neither nonexistent nor existent,
heard, yet silent and hushed.

A jade flask, ice-pure, cleanses heart and bone,
deep and vast as clouds, the sky of snow and moon.

**Mercury**
**Mercury, mercury.**
Still,
unmoving.
The Dao’s passage,
the spirit’s function.
Piercing gold, penetrating stone,
a sword cleaving the seamless.
The jade infant cradles the precious moon,
playfully toying with crystal.

A day of silver mist, interwoven with light,
glittering neither far nor near.
Wielded as the sacred ancestor’s Daoist wind,
ancient tones pierce the pure, pure resonance.

**Principle**
**Principle, principle.**
Sun’s essence,
moon’s marrow.
Above, it connects to heaven,
below, it penetrates earth.
Within and without, they merge—
its spirit not spectral.
Radiant, blazing the celestial thoroughfare,
brilliant, its light enters the body.
Square or round, curved or straight, following form,
supreme goodness—heart deep as water.
Congealing in emptiness, crystalline and clear,
profound and luminous, fused to the very depths.

**One**
**One, one.**

**Difficult to embody, difficult to practice.**
Crooked yet aligned with the upright,
bent yet attuned to the straight.
The great square has no corners,
solitary in vast stillness.
Clear as day before one’s eyes,
yet the man facing it does not recognize.
Grasping or relinquishing—neither adds nor subtracts,
seeking yields no end, no limit.

From ancient times, the one luminous true nature manifests,
turning light back to fill the true void of the Great Emptiness.

**Profound**
**Profound, profound.**
Vast as the boundless paths,
minute as the distant byways.
Beyond all seeking,
without flaw or blame.
Neither being nor non-being,
neither void nor form.
Vastness so immense it has no breadth,
subtlety so fine it has no narrowness.
Ponder it—spirit scatters in silent vastness,
contemplate it—soul dissolves like drifting clouds.
Endless, infinite, unknowable,
now departing, now arriving, like a passing traveler.

**Vague**
**Vague, vague.**
Heaven and earth,
sealed and brimming.
Within the primordial chaos,
congealed in the valley of emptiness.
Empty yet not empty,
things yet no things.
Something exists, merged with the mysterious origin,
the mysterious origin surging with supreme virtue.
Divine radiance—dim and obscure,
Dao’s transformation—hushed and silent.
Suddenly, one truth seizes heaven’s mechanism,
the true rule of the Great One within the alchemical crucible.

**Mysterious**
**Mysterious, mysterious.**
The Supreme Ultimate,
boundless.
Below, it shifts earth,
above, it connects to heaven.
Essence of the Three Luminaries refined,
one qi luminously transmitted.
The furnace gate opens two paths,
dragon and tiger contend in the vanguard.
Playfully coaxing the bright pearl from the sea,
casting it skyward, rolling earthward with thunderous clamor.
Once the elixir is formed, shedding the husk to wander the Three Isles,
carefree in the Penglai gardens, years uncounted.

**Numinous**
**Numinous, numinous.**

Qi flourishes, spirit clarifies.
Congealing to chase the moon, dazzling to outrace the stars.
In high emptiness, gracious illumination;
across the great earth, purity and brightness.
Luminous as ice and snow,
translucent as crystal.
Vast and shimmering, heaven and earth gleam immaculate;
radiant and resplendent, the realm knows perfect peace.
The five directions’ rosy hues gather into the crucible,
the twin luminaries’ intersecting light enters the precious vase.

**Heaven**
**Heaven, heaven.**
Profound, profound.
Master of a thousand mechanisms,
wielder of ten thousand transformations.
Gazing upward—ever more lofty;
delving deeper—ever more steadfast.
Above, it invades the realm of Primordial Beginning;
below, it blankets the boundless vast.
Limpid beyond the Five Phases,
obscure before the Eight Trigrams.
At first division, one qi at the head of the Three Powers;
alone and solitary, it precedes the Emperor of Images.

**Mechanism**
**Mechanism, mechanism.**
Embodying the Dao, the heart knows.
Opening the eye of wisdom,
awakening to the subtle and silent.
Shifting spirit through ten thousand changes,
wondrous transformation through non-action.
Non-action generates one qi,
one qi moves the Three Marvels.
Blending the refined and the anciently pure,
passing through movement, stillness, and abiding without doubt.
Perceiving things, the heart illumines—yet the heart departs from things;
in profound obscurity, bearing and demeanor transcend convention.

**Stream**
**Stream, stream.**

Ancient banks, golden dikes.
Filling the Dao-eye, wisdom’s radiance shines.
Trickling without cease,
flowing into the celestial pool.
Azure waters open the pure valley,
profound depths stir the boundless vast.
Along the banks, fish sport in play;
from the wave’s heart, a sacred tortoise leaps forth.
Its mouth sprays crimson mist where golden sands congeal,
nurturing the divine elixir to match the sacred mechanism.

**Pill**
**Pill, pill, pill.**
Gathered in a pinch, brows knit in concentration.
Piercing the Dao-eye, embodying the profound mystery.
Responding to things, the mechanism appears;
adapting to all shapes, assuming every form.
Illumining the numinous yang’s awakening,
the mind’s clarity expands the dharma-realm.
Heaven and earth cycle with sun and moon;
in the void, tigers coil and dragons entwine.
The elixir terrace cradles the Three Luminaries’ blaze,
a flawless, gleaming orb of jade.

**Sprout**
**Sprout, sprout, sprout.**
Merit deepens, wonders multiply.
Rooted firmly, let nothing stray.
Constantly replenish mercury’s waters,
daily advance lead’s sands.
The numinous shoot first emerges from soil,
unfolding into golden blossoms of beauty.
Tender beyond Chang’e’s cinnamon,
verdant as the Queen Mother’s immortal blooms.
Gathered, it may attend the Ever-Spring Assembly;
boldly, it may boast in Jasper Pool or Penglai’s gardens.

**Snow**
**Snow, snow.**

No cold, no chill.
Within existence it arises, in emptiness it is arrayed.
Ethereal without gap, crystalline and translucent.
Shimmering, the Great Void brightens;
resplendent, its light gleams pure.
The boundless sky, silken as a silver river;
the vast earth, cleansed like jade dust.
The scorching red sun cannot melt it—
through all seasons it keeps company with the high moon.

**Thus**
**Thus, thus.**
Most wondrous, profoundly mysterious.
Illumining true nature, nurturing the numinous source.
Transmitted yet not conferred,
its meaning grasped beyond words.
The Three Fields brim with lush essence;
with every breath, qi flows unbroken.
Inhaling and exhaling, never leaving the Mysterious Female—
do not take mouth or nose as the cause.
Within the wuwei crucible, the Three Flowers bloom;
from the red furnace, the seven-petaled lotus emerges.

**Secrecy**
**Secrecy, secrecy.**
No form, no trace.
Drawing in the pure wind, summoning the gracious sun.
Serene and solitary,
vast and independent.
A thousand points of pristine light,
ten thousand streams of numinous essence.
Within it, a luminous pearl is born—
once refined, the Embryonic Immortal is complete.
Leisurely, it emerges from the Three Realms’ surging waves,
knowing the destination on Penglai’s path.

chunks.original_text: 上清太玄集 经名：上清太玄集。 十卷。 金侯善渊撰。 底本出处：《 正统道藏》 太玄部。 上清太玄集卷之一 姑射侯善渊述 通明论 上清元化章第一 上清元化，隆睦开图。 豫而为之者，道也。 终而复始者，性也。 忠不宗则含德之容冲玄髻髯，象若琼瑭间间，而以徽徽然哉。 悦风韵之音，倡元晶之旭，颉翼无拘，乃游道之方矣。 冲祖则大而无外，细而无内，上圆下方，天地形名，内阐氤氲之气。 束出西没，日月升沉。 巨化暹昱之明，心物凝之炯然，无不敏其令也。 奕善之逵章第二 奕善之逵，在用之常也。 视之大象，大象无形，形之则非眩於目，自然光溢无极矣。 是以离娄能视，犹斯未证其慧也。 听之大音，大音希声，声之则非乱於耳，自然欲适无方矣。 是以师旷能听，犹斯未证其聪也。 至聪至慧、至变至通，皆授生夷道之中矣。 表物穷理章第三 表物穷理，靖式若容。 咀移玄览、璟泄凝彤。 明则匿於间，生则伏其衰。 机禧释悯以至常容，淳伸之格乃绝祸患之门也。 契道登真章第四 契道登真，以致善功。 三界之动，非碍不通。 一者物之随化，道之体也； 应而显形，神之用也。 用之无用，用之至矣。 二者机临众象，仰启瞳蒙，光而不耀者，是以无色。 无色之色，色之至矣。 三者符空非有，执有不空。 不空之空，是谓真空。 总而通之，出乎无伦。 巩性无生章第五 巩性无生，悦之有化，善应则终身无塞。 外禅宽舒，旷然虚静者，人道与天道相通也。 嚏息和融，氤氲应兆，皓然精粹者，冲气与元气相接也。 举盼凝祥，灵乌降瑞，两耀交光者，睛瞳与日月合其明也。 然则飞玄六洞，妙化三宫，分而为之九气，聚而为之一真。 一真之变，在乎无为之为也。 得之与失章第六 得之与失，应用不同。 得者，贵精爱气，保命颐神，抱其道而怀其德也。 失者，矜饕嗜欲，意乱心荒，忘其本而匿其真也。 通玄释伪，勃章威灵，开元醒聪者，遂即提毅之功也。 敛意精思章第七 敛意精思，怡然致靖。 内敌琅函，颇若婴儿之貌也。 摄理之庸，顺常之豫者，谊无过失，正性善感其机也。 谧之则非碎之眸，益欲之至也。 俑之则不砚之砚，益防之及也。 衷格之变通易无、极方隅不定者，是在用无化之化也。 道伟含融章第八 道伟含融，肆无不际。 上覆无极，提挈乾纲，天圆立像，日月星临，垂光昼夜，神而通之，无不合其明也。 下宰无极，掌握坤柔，地方立像，山谷盈虚，依时泄化，万物生成，无不在其中矣。 至弘至大，大无不包，至微至细，细无不入，衍之则混理，同机甫摄，谊无不和也。 非道之道章第九 非道之道，存而忘之，顺理之常，忘其物而存其真者，所以致其度也。 一应物忘心，弃常之理，存其欲而失其本者，所以致其叩也。 哲截通之不然，如斯非见之见，是谓真见； 非应之应，是谓真应。 应化不临，遍知无极之道也。 衷息之逵章第十 衷息之逵，知夫致敏。 静者制其动，正者制其邪。 顺渝之宪，巩质规一函，存夷之动者，遂即裕常之肇也。 无所不化章第十一 无所不化，是谓大通。 纳流而不溢者，乃道之渊也。 凝虚而不满者，乃道之邃也。 混气而不盈者，乃道之弘也。 在朝而不明者，乃道之常也。 在徊，昏而不昧者，乃道之理也。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Clarity Great Mystery Collection**

**Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Great Mystery Collection*
**Ten fascicles.** Authored by Jin Hou Shanyuan.
**Source text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Great Mystery Section.

---

### *The Supreme Clarity Great Mystery Collection, Fascicle One*
**By Hou Shanyuan of Gushe**

#### **Chapter One: On the Primordial Transformation of Supreme Clarity**
The Primordial Transformation of Supreme Clarity unfolds in harmonious splendor, revealing the celestial chart.
That which precedes all things is the Dao.
That which ends only to begin anew is nature.
When loyalty does not adhere to sectarianism, the countenance of one who embodies virtue becomes serene and profound—his temples and beard like jade set amidst luminous clarity, radiant with subtle grace.
Delighting in the melody of harmonious winds, he intones the dawn of primordial essence. Unfettered in flight, he roams the paths of the Dao.
The Primordial Ancestor is vast yet without exterior, minute yet without interior; above, round like heaven; below, square like earth. In form and name, it inwardly unfolds the intermingling qi.
Bound by the east’s emergence and the west’s descent, the sun and moon rise and set.
The radiance of great transformation illumines all—mind and matter congeal in brilliance, none fail to respond to its command.

#### **Chapter Two: The Path of Flourishing Virtue**
The path of flourishing virtue lies in its constant application.
Behold the great image: the great image is formless. To give it form is to dazzle the eye, yet naturally its light overflows without limit.
Thus, even one as keen-sighted as Li Lou cannot attest to true wisdom.
Listen to the great sound: the great sound is soundless. To give it sound is to confuse the ear, yet naturally it harmonizes without direction.
Thus, even one as keen-eared as Shi Kuang cannot attest to true hearing.
Utmost hearing, utmost wisdom, utmost adaptability, utmost penetration—all are bestowed within the Dao of the primordial and the level.

#### **Chapter Three: Manifesting Things and Exhausting Principles**
To manifest things and exhaust principles is to embody stillness and receptivity.
Chew and shift the mysterious vision; let jade-like radiance and crimson essence flow forth.
In clarity, it conceals itself in the intervals; in life, it subdues decline.
The mechanism of fortune releases sorrow, attaining constancy; the pattern of pure extension severs the gate of calamity.

#### **Chapter Four: Harmonizing with the Dao and Ascending to Perfection**
To harmonize with the Dao and ascend to perfection is to achieve meritorious virtue.
Movement within the Three Realms is unobstructed only when no barriers exist.
First: things follow transformation—this is the essence of the Dao. Responding and manifesting form is the function of spirit. To employ the useless is the ultimate use.
Second: the mechanism confronts the myriad forms, lifting the veils of ignorance. Shining yet not dazzling—this is the colorless. The color of the colorless is the ultimate color.
Third: the tally of emptiness is not possession; clinging to possession is not emptiness. The emptiness of non-emptiness is called true emptiness.
Comprehending these in unity transcends all bounds.

#### **Chapter Five: Fortifying Nature and Non-Birth**
To fortify nature and embrace non-birth is to delight in transformation. Responding with virtue ensures a life without obstruction.
External meditation is expansive and relaxed; in vast emptiness and stillness, the human Dao merges with the celestial Dao.
Breath harmonizes and fuses; the intermingling qi responds to signs. In luminous purity, the primordial qi and the vital qi connect.
Gaze fixed in auspicious concentration, the numinous bird descends as an omen; the two luminaries exchange radiance—pupil and sun-moon unite their brightness.
Thus, the Six Caverns of Flying Mystery and the wondrous transformations of the Three Palaces divide into the nine qi, converging into the One True.
The transformations of the One True lie in the action of non-action.

#### **Chapter Six: On Gain and Loss**
Gain and loss differ in their application.
To gain is to treasure essence, cherish qi, preserve life, and nurture spirit—embracing the Dao and holding fast to virtue.
To lose is to indulge in greed and desire, mind in chaos and heart in desolation—forgetting one’s root and concealing one’s truth.
To penetrate the mystery and dispel falsehood, to invigorate numinous power and awaken wisdom, is to achieve the merit of resolute advancement.

#### **Chapter Seven: Gathering Intent and Refining Thought**
To gather intent and refine thought is to attain joyful tranquility.
Within, the jade casket appears, resembling the visage of an infant.
The constancy of governing principle and the harmony of natural ease ensure no transgressions; the upright nature keenly senses the mechanism.
To silence it is not to shatter the eye but to heighten desire.
To model it is not to grind the inkstone but to strengthen vigilance.
The transformations of the inner pattern—unbounded and without fixed direction—lie in the action of non-transforming transformation.

#### **Chapter Eight: The Dao’s Vast Embrace**
The Dao’s vast embrace extends without limit.
Above, it covers without bound, upholding the celestial net. Heaven’s roundness establishes its image; sun, moon, and stars descend. Their light hangs day and night, numinous and penetrating—none fail to align with its brightness.
Below, it governs without bound, grasping earth’s yielding nature. Earth’s squareness establishes its image; mountains and valleys fill and empty. Following the seasons, they release transformation—all things arise and are completed within it.
Utmost vastness, utmost greatness—greatness encompasses all. Utmost subtlety, utmost minuteness—minuteness enters all. To extend it is to blend principles; to unify mechanisms is to harmonize all without exception.

#### **Chapter Nine: The Dao Beyond Dao**
The Dao beyond Dao exists yet is forgotten. Following principle’s constancy, forgetting things yet preserving truth—this is how one attains its measure.
Responding to things while forgetting the mind, abandoning principle’s constancy, preserving desire yet losing one’s root—this is how one invites inquiry.
The wise discern this distinction. Such is the seeing beyond sight—this is true seeing. The response beyond response—this is true response.
To respond without imposing transformation is to pervade the boundless Dao.

#### **Chapter Ten: The Path of Inner Stillness**
The path of inner stillness knows the way to keen responsiveness.
Stillness governs movement; uprightness governs deviation.
The law of compliance and change fortifies the substance, unifying the casket. The movement of preserving the level initiates the constancy of abundance.

#### **Chapter Eleven: The All-Transforming**
To be all-transforming is to attain great penetration.
Receiving streams without overflowing—this is the Dao’s abyss.
Congealing emptiness without filling—this is the Dao’s profundity.
Blending qi without excess—this is the Dao’s vastness.
Present in court yet unseen—this is the Dao’s constancy.
Lingering in obscurity yet undimmed—this is the Dao’s principle.

#### **Chapter Eleven (continued)**
Responding to things without cessation—this is the Dao’s transformation.
Communing with spirits without loss—this is the Dao’s fidelity.
Bestowing life without discrimination—this is the Dao’s virtue.
Those who turn their backs on it possess it in full; who can attest to its truth?
Thus do they cast themselves into ruin.

#### **Chapter Twelve: Abandoning the False and Preserving the True**
Abandoning the false and preserving the true, forgetting schemes and severing cares,
all secrecy and pretense dissolve—sincerity of heart and steadfast resolve.
Abiding in stillness, the clamor of disturbance brings no vexation;
serene and holding to simplicity, the spirit’s breath rests in unbroken ease—
this is how clarity is distilled.
Abiding in loyalty, the gourd of prohibitions knows no selfishness;
joyful and nurturing vastness, pure and flourishing—
this is how fidelity is established.
Abiding in virtue, humility veils its light, essence and refinement embrace all;
the unadulterated wind conceals its resonance—
this is how the Dao is joined.
The true Dao walks alone; the defiled Dao is wholly consumed.
To know this as an obstacle is to miss the mark.

#### **Chapter Thirteen: Utmost Sincerity, Utmost Rectitude**
Utmost sincerity, utmost rectitude—delusion and awakening are two mechanisms.
The deluded cling to illusion;
the awakened refine their truth.
Truth is not seen by the eye—gazing upon it dazzles the senses.
Illusion is not grasped by the mind—discerning it verifies wisdom.
The spirit fills the empty valley; abundance must roam freely.
Severing yet penetrating it—this is the repose of sitting in the flowering garden.

#### **Chapter Fourteen: Turning from Awakening to Merge with Dust**
Turning from awakening to merge with dust is to revert to the supreme Dao.
The possession of possessions is foreseen by the possession of no-possession—
gaining it, one loses it, thus becoming a peril to the body.
The use of uses is foreseen by the use of no-use—
preserving it, one forgets it, thus becoming a fetter to the heart.
The color of colors is foreseen by the color of no-color—
illuminating it, one obscures it, thus becoming a dazzlement to the eyes.
The sound of sounds is foreseen by the sound of no-sound—
speaking of it, one silences it, thus becoming a strain to the ears.
The transformation of transformations is foreseen by the transformation of no-transformation—
rescuing it, one betrays it, thus becoming a confusion to the spirit.
Upholding correctness and returning to purity, refining thought and sharpening responsiveness—
this is how one skillfully severs all faults.

#### **Chapter Fifteen: Refining the Subtle and Radiant**
Refining the subtle and radiant—why chase after mere adornments?
Clamor and splendor each cling to their vessels;
secrecy and favor each invite their transgressions.
Yet in the midst of resplendent ornamentation, one suddenly awakens—
the spirit’s eyes open wide, the celestial breath rests in tranquil repose,
sitting in the attainment of spontaneity.
Spontaneity as such is not spontaneity;
not-spontaneity as spontaneity—this is the perfection of spontaneity.

#### **Eulogy**
Seeking the true and revering the teachings, aspirations and vows remain earnest.
